title.rendered: Complimentary Admission Ticket For Arts on the Credit

content.rendered: My upcoming Arts on the Credit show is fast approaching, more details on this fine craft and art show can be found here. If you print the ticket below and bring it you can save the $5 admission charge to the show.

content.rendered:
A very busy winter for art is now underway. I have 3 shows going on all over the city and I invite you to visit them all. Let’s get right to it and let you know where they are…

Art Gallery of Mississauga

My Painting ‘Spock’ has been selected for the Visual Arts Mississauga’s 35th Annual Juried Show of Fine Arts which is at the Art Gallery of Mississauga.

Show Dates:
January 17 – March 2, 2013

Art Gallery of Mississauga
300 City Centre Drive.
Mississauga, ON L5B 3C1
more information

Rainbow Cinemas Toronto

I will be showing 6 pieces of my art for the entire month of February at Rainbow Cinemas in the St. Lawrence Market neighborhood of Toronto. Special thanks to Art for All Canada for helping to make this possible.

Show Dates:
February 1 – February 28, 2013

Rainbow Cinemas
80 Front Street E. at Jarvis
more information


Visual Arts Mississauga’s Valentine Show & Sale

My painting “Hearts” will be at Visual Arts Mississauga’s Valentine Show & Sale, February 4-10th 2013 at…

Show Dates:
February 4 – February 10, 2013

Visual Arts Mississauga
4170 Riverwood Park Lane
Mississauga, Ontario
L5C 2S7
more information

In the Studio

Continuing to play with a science fiction theme, I am pleased to have finished C3PO which is made up of Darth Vader pixels. This painting will be at rainbow Cinemas show for the month of February.

C3PO
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

title.rendered: Visual Arts Mississauga's 35th Annual Juried Show of Fine Arts

content.rendered:
My Painting ‘Spock’ has been selected for the Visual Arts Mississauga’s 35th Annual Juried Show of Fine Arts  which is at the Art Gallery of Mississauga.

The Opening Night is Thursday, January 17, 2013, 6 pm at AGM and all are welcome to attend.

Show Duration: January 17 – March 2, 2013

Art Gallery of Mississauga
300 City Centre Drive.
Mississauga, ON L5B 3C1

content.rendered:
Beaux Art Brampton Christmas Art Show and Sale

I am participating in the Beaux Art Brampton Christmas Art show which started Dec. 4th. I have one piece in this years show, Spock as seen to the right. The opening reception is Wednesday December 12 from 7-9 pm and all are welcome.

Show Dates:
December 4 – January 5, 2013

Media: A variety of painting, oil, watercolour, acrylic, mixed media work, jewelry, greeting cards, mosaics, pottery and much more.

Artists: Participating members of Beaux-Arts Brampton
Opening Reception: Wednesday December 12, 7 to 9 pm

Beaux-Arts Brampton
70-74 Main Street North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Tel: (905) 454-5677 Toll Free: 1-866-339-7779
Visit my website for more information

In the Studio

Working with 2 very bright colours to produce a vibrant pixelated optical illusion with hearts.

Hearts
Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 30″

 

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

title.rendered: Arts on the Credit Art Show in Mississauga: April 2013

content.rendered:
In April 2013 I will once again be at Arts on the Credit with all of my art for sale along with 30 other artists and craftsman. Last year was a great event and I am looking forward to attending again.

Date: April 27-28, 2013

Waterside Inn
15 Stavebank Road South,
Mississauga,
Ontario L5G 2T2
toll-free: (877) 264-7770
(905) 891-7770

Click here for a complimentary Admission Ticket For Arts on the Credit.

title.rendered: Rainbow Cinemas Toronto Art Show – February 2013

content.rendered:
I will be showing my artwork for the entire month of February at Rainbow Cinemas in the St. Lawrence Market neighborhood of Toronto.  Special thanks to Art for All Canada for helping to make this possible.

Where to find it

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis. Click here for a Google map. It is a bit tricky to find as it is inside of an open promenade. When viewed from Front St. with St. Lawrence Market behind you, you will see the Rainbow Cinema sign inside the walkway.

title.rendered: Beaux Art Brampton Christmas Art Show and Sale

content.rendered:
I am participating in the Beaux Art Brampton Christmas Art show which started Dec 4th. I have one piece in this years show, Spock as seen on right. The show details are below.

Show Dates: December 4 – January 5, 2013

Media: A variety of painting, oil, watercolour, acrylic, mixed media work, jewelry, greeting cards, mosaics, pottery and much more.

Artists: Participating members of Beaux-Arts Brampton

Opening Reception: Wednesday December 12, 7 to 9 pm

Location: Beaux-Arts Brampton is located in the centre of downtown Brampton right next to Vivian Lane and Cycle Path.

70-74 Main Street North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Tel: (905) 454-5677 Toll Free: 1-866-339-7779

title.rendered: Dark Star Orchestra at The Opera House

content.rendered:
November 15th I attended the Darkstar Orchestra concert the Opera House in Toronto. An amazing show, I really could not tell the difference in some of the jams between them and the Grateful Dead, and I saw the Grateful Dead play 150 times. I got lost completely in the dancing which I haven’t done for a long time. I dance all the time and love it, both swing and house music, but nothing beats Grateful Dead Music.

The show they played was the Auditorium Theatre, Chicago, ILL (6/26/76)

Promised Land
Sugaree
Cassidy
Row Jimmy
Mama Tried
Tennessee Jed
Looks Like Rain
Scarlet Begonias
Lazy Lightnin’
Supplication
Peggy-O
Music Never Stopped

Playin’ in the Band
St. Stephen
The Wheel
Playin’ in the Band
Samson and Delilah
Crazy Fingers
Stella Blue
Around and Around
One More Saturday Night

U.S. Blues

Then they threw in a Mr Charlie for good measure… I hope they come back to Canada soon.

content.rendered:
Awesome night last night at the Sound Academy, I attended the Die Antwoord show and had a great time. I spent most of this show right up front in the pit and it was pretty crazy in there. Like a rolling sea in a storm and I had a lot of fun.

They opened the show with some awesome house music, Paul Kalkbrenner was especially awesome and had some great beats. Unfortunately I was not able to get a setlist for this show, if any get posted online that I find I will be sure to repost.

I would say that Die Antwoord is a must see band, awesome show.

title.rendered: Jack White at Sony Center Oct 4 Concert Review

content.rendered:
I was totally blown away at this show and I have become a Jack White fan for life. I barely knew any of his music before the show and loved every second of it.

I took my son Brenden to see this show as he is a big fan and I became a fan myself. One thing I liked the most was the jamming, he went from one song into the next with taking a break, blending it all together in these massive jams, similar to how the Grateful Dead used to do it back in the beginning. I love both his new solo work and The White Stripes songs.

Below is the setlist.

Missing Pieces
Sixteen Saltines
Cannon / Wasting My Time (The White Stripes song)
Freedom At 21
Love Interruption
Blunderbuss
Top Yourself (The Raconteurs song)
I Cut Like A Buffalo (The Dead Weather song)
I Guess I Should Go to Sleep
The Same Boy You’ve Always Known (The White Stripes song)
Blue Blood Blues (The Dead Weather song)
Steady, As She Goes (The Raconteurs song)
Two Against One (Danger Mouse cover)
We’re Going to Be Friends (The White Stripes song)
Weep Themselves to Sleep
Broken Boy Soldier / Hello Operator (The White Stripes song)
Ball and Biscuit (The White Stripes song)

Encore:
The Hardest Button to Button (The White Stripes song)
Take Me With You When You Go
Catch Hell Blues (The White Stripes song)
Seven Nation Army

title.rendered: Self portrait of Justin Blayney is complete

content.rendered:
It has been a slow summer for creating art, I have spent most of my time showing my artwork in and around the Toronto area. I have just completed a pixelated self portrait in squares and I am feeling kind of on the fence about it. So I will leave it here for now, all comments and feedback are welcome. It is 36 inches squares and acrylic on canvas. I included the bamboo and table to give it some perspective. Up close it is very abstract and it is very hard to see any image.

One thing I am happy about is that I figured out a way to create more accuracy when painting the squares. I am using painting blind when using squares because of the massive  amounts of taping required.

content.rendered:
Tomorrow (Saturday August 10) I will have some of my artwork at the Brampton Farmers Market which will be located on Main Street in downtown Brampton. I will be located at Beaux-Arts Brampton, 74 Main N  Brampton, ON L6V 1N7, on the street directly in front of the gallery.

If you are in the area, please stop by and say hello. I will be there form 8 am until noon.

title.rendered: My Contemporary Art for purchase at Cube Works

content.rendered:
I am pleased to announce that 2 of my pop art paintings are now on display and for sale at Cube Works. I met with the gallery at the TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) and we both feel that my artwork fits right in with the pixelated art theme of the gallery.

The 2 pixelated pop art paintings we have at the gallery are “Discarded” and “At Ease” as seen below.

About Cube Works
Cube Works Studio has become world renowned for our work twisting Rubik’s cubes into stunning, cutting-edge works of art. As a small collaborative of specialized talents, our studio is focused on pushing the boundaries of modern art using the brightly-coloured cubes as a distinct and universally identifiable medium.

content.rendered:
Thank you to everyone who came to visit and stopped to chat at the Big on Bloor art show (Bloor Alternative Art Fair). I had a great couple of days and good company from both the visitors and my fellow artists who were displaying in my area.

Ngadi J Smart (ngadismart.com) and Leone McComas (leonemccomas.com) are two talented artists from the show who you need to check out.

Above is a great photo of me taken by Miklos Legrady (www.mikloslegrady.com).

title.rendered: Pixel Art at Beaux-Arts Brampton Market

content.rendered:
I will have my contemporary artwork on display at Beaux-Arts Brampton which will be located right in the middle of the farmers market on August 11 from 8:00 am to 12:30 pm.

Most of my work will be available for purchase, please come out and say hello to me, buy some artwork and support the local farmers.

Beaux-Arts Brampton is located in the centre of downtown Brampton
right next to Vivian Lane and Cycle Path.

70-74 Main Street North
Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Tel: (905) 454-5677
Toll Free: 1-866-339-7779

content.rendered:
At the past TOAE (Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition) I had a bit of an accident, my wall blew down and one of my paintings got scraped and punctured. So the last few days I learned how to repair a punctured canvas. I’m very grateful my art has solid colours so repainting after was relatively simple.

To fix the hole what I did was:
1.  Place a piece of canvas to the back of the painting then attach it in Gesso.
2.  Apply 5 coats of gesso to front to build it up
3. Sand down the Gesso
4. Re-paint

Thats all it took, it looks perfect now, you can’t even see that anything happened. See photos for before and after (sorry photos are different hues, thats from taking photos with different lighting).

content.rendered:
Last weekend at the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition I was approached by Carol Frilegh who shared with me her love of Victor Vasarely and one of her art pieces. Vasarely’s work can be seen as an influence of mine and she picked up on that right away.

Carol shared a needlepoint she had created of the Orion style of Vasarely and I wanted to post it so others could enjoy. She did a fantastic job.

content.rendered:
Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition

I will be at Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition this weekend with all of my art for sale along with 350 other artists. The Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition runs July 6, 7, and 8 from 10:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. at Nathan Philips Square in Downtown Toronto.

My Booth (291) will be located between the stage and City Hall (please see map). Nathan Phillips Square is a city square that forms the front (south) entrance to Toronto City Hall at Queen Street West and Bay Street. The address is 100 Queen Street West.

TTC/Parking
Located at 100 Queen Street West, Nathan Phillips Square is easily accessed by the TTC Queen street car (501), the Yonge Line subway (exit Queen station) or the University line (exit Osgoode Station).

BIG on Bloor Festival

Saturday July 21st and Sunday July 22nd, 2012, from 1 to 9 pm. I will be showcasing my art at the BIG on Bloor Festival.

Bloor Street from Dufferin to Lansdowne celebrates local business, community, arts and culture with a unique community and city-building festival. The festival features hundreds of events, activities and exhibitions.

www.bigonbloor.com

 

In the Studio

I have just completed my latest painting which is as yet untitled. It is based on a photo from Nils Blondon of a homeless man which I think is fabulous. I used pixel hearts to create this painting, the message being that we all deserve love, no matter where we are in life. Medium:

Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

I have just completed my latest painting which is as yet untitled. It is based on a photo from Nils Blondon of a homeless man which I think is fabulous. I used pixel hearts to create this painting, the message being that we all deserve love, no matter where we are in life.

This is the first painting which will be a series of heart pixel paintings, be sure to check in soon to see the new paintings. I think using the hearts, a commissioned heart painting would be a great gift for any lovers.

 

Below is the original painting and a close up of the hearts.

title.rendered: The 7th Spirit Yogathon – 108 Sun Salutations and Kirtan

content.rendered:
One of my favorite yoga studios ( Free Spirit Yoga ) is having a charity yoga event in Port Credit, it is a yogathon to raise money for world hunger. If you are interested in either sponsoring me or participating, please contact me or download the registration form here. More details below…

On Saturday June 23rd, 2012: The 7th Spirit Yogathon
Come to have fun, expand your being, support and give service to those hungry in the world. All included in the Yogathon! This year, the Yogathon is all about … expansion.  And itself, the Yogathon is expanding since this year we will be joined by friends internationally!  And, there will be a Kirtan for the first time ever at this event,  guaranteed to raise your vibration and elevate your spirit.

Here is how the Spirit Yogathon works:
9:00 am –  Registration – coffee and tea, cosmic cookies and fruit provided by Starbucks and Planet Organic.
9:30 am – Warm up
10:00 am – 12 noon  Yogathon (108 Sun Salutations for World Hunger)
12:30 pm – 3:30pm – Garden party and lunch (everyone is invited to stay and are welcome to take a refreshing swim, make a mala from beads, or socialize)
3:30 pm – Draw for prizes  (all registrants and attendees contributing the minimum donation of $20.00 will be entered in a draw for prizes)
4:30 – 6 pm – Kirtan
6:00 pm – Bonfire and celebrations

Interested? Excited? Ready for radical expansion?
In this case, please:
1. Recommend the event to a friend or to your family that may be a yoga enthusiast.
2. If you would like to bring a favorite dish or beverage to share it would be greatly appreciated.
3. Do a last minute push on your fundraising, for the World Food Program.
4. Children participating would need to be accompanied by an adult.

content.rendered: Once the summer hits I find that I slow down with painting and spend a lot of time outside on my bike or sitting around sipping coffee. I do have one painting in progress and have been dragging my heels over and can be seen to the right still covered in tape and stickers. I am down to the final stages or smoothing out the colors before I rip the tape off and reveal the final painting.

title.rendered: Discarded painting on display in Brampton

content.rendered:
My painting “Discarded”, known by some as “Star Baby” (I may rename it) is currently on display at Beaux-Arts Brampton for the next week in the Art Cove Gallery.

It will only be there for a week in the Quick Draw Exhibit, so please take a trip and visit it and all the other great art which is at the gallery.

A special thanks to Nils Blondon for use of his photograph. nilsphoto.tumblr.com, keep your eyes open for my next piece which is also using one of Nils photos.

title.rendered: Grown up Hippie – now a certified yoga instructor

content.rendered:
I just recently graduated a 200 hour Hatha Yoga Course and I am now a certified yoga instructor. I took an Anusara influenced course from Leewi Yoga in Port Credit under the instruction of Michael Siddall.

So now I am an artist, yoga instructor and web developer, your basic all round grown up hippie. It is good to keep busy. I will post any Yoga classes I will be teaching here, keeps your eyes open for a possible new yoga page.

Thank you to all my teachers and Leewi Yoga.

content.rendered:
I have just been accepted for the Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition for 2012 and  I am very excited to be part of this event. It will run from July 6-8 at Nathan Philips Square downtown Toronto and admission is free.

TTC/Parking
Located at 100 Queen Street West, Nathan Phillips Square is easily accessed by the TTC Queen street car (501), the Yonge Line subway (exit Queen station) or the University line (exit Osgoode Station).

The Toronto Outdoor Art Exhibition (TOAE) is Canada’s largest juried outdoor art exhibition. Taking place every July on Nathan Phillips Square, it is one of Toronto’s most vibrant public social events, and an economic and inspirational benefit to Ontario’s creative and cultural communities. Since 1961, over 20,000 artists have shown their work at this annual art event in Toronto.

content.rendered:
Arts on the Credit

I will be at Arts on the Credit this weekend with all of my art for sale along with 30 other artists and craftsman. Arts on the Credit is an annual fine art and craft show. It is a juried, invitational event meant to provide a venue for fine artists to show and sell their exquisite work. Arts on the Credit will be held at the Waterside Inn, in the village of Port Credit, on April 21 & 22, 2012, from 11 am – 5 pm. Be sure to visit the website for further information. Please find your complimentary ticket below.

BIG on Bloor Festival

Saturday July 21st and Sunday July 22nd, 2012, from 1 to 9 pm. I will be showcasing my art at the BIG on Bloor Festival.

Bloor Street from Dufferin to Lansdowne celebrates local business, community, arts and culture with a unique community and city-building festival. The festival features hundreds of events, activities and exhibitions.

www.bigonbloor.com

In the Studio

Discarded is my latest painting and will be on display at Arts on the Credit.

Experimenting with different shapes (stars) and now working with a photographer. A photo of a doll head inspired the latest painting.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 36″ x 36″

content.rendered:
I have just finished a painting which I have titled Discarded. This painting was a lot of fun as I am now exploring different shapes, and for this one I used stars to make up the pattern.

A special thank to Nils Blondon for permission to use his photograph of a Dolls Head.

title.rendered: I Mother Earth / The Bright Light Social Hour Concert

content.rendered:
I attended  the I Mother Earth concert at the Sound Academy last Friday and had a great time. They put on a great show and had a long set.

One thing that really impressed me though was the opening band “The Bright Light Social Hour“, they blew me away. I bought their CD and have listened to it over and over again that last week. Check them out on YouTube.

Here is the set list

The Mothers
Summertime in the Void
Levitate
Juicy
All Awake
We Got The Love
Earth Sky & C
0157:H7
I is Us
Like the Sun
Like a Girl
Songburst and Delerium
Good for Sule
Used to be Alright
Rain Will Fall
Another Sunday
One More Astronaut
Meat Dreams
Passenger

Encore:
And the Experience
Shortcut to Moncton

Encore 2:
Three Days Old

content.rendered:
Beaux-Arts Brampton: 5th Annual Open Juried Art Show

My latest painting “Transitions in Brightness” (see below) has been accepted at the Beaux-Arts Brampton 5th Annual Open Juried Art Show. The show will be running from Tuesday March 27 – Saturday April 21, 2012.

There will be an opening awards reception on Friday March 30 2012 from 6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m. and the public is encouraged and welcome to attend.

Beaux-Arts Brampton
70-74 Main Street
North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Gallery Hours:
Tues-Fri Noon-6pm, Sat 9am-3pm
www.beaux-artsbrampton.com

Arts on the Credit

I have just been approved by a jury to participate in Arts on the Credit, which is a 2 day Arts and Crafts show in Port Credit. I will have a booth and all my contemporary artwork will be on display and for sale.

Arts on the Credit is an annual fine craft and art show. It is a juried, invitational event meant to provide a venue for the finest artists to show and sell their exquisite work. Arts on the Credit will be held at the Waterside Inn, in the village of Port Credit, on April 21 & 22, 2012, from 11 am – 5 pm.

Be sure to visit the website if you need more information and to print your complimentary ticket.

In the Studio

Transitions in Brightness is my latest painting and will be on display at Arts on the Credit.

Playing with the subtleties of yellow with the same pattern as Orange on Blue Chrome. A very bright painting to light your room.

Medium: Acrylic on Canvas
Size: 30″ x 30″

title.rendered: Pinterest for fun and promoting contemporary artwork

content.rendered:
I have just joined Pinterest and have been having fun posting my artwork and other peoples art and photos. I was surprised to see that a great many of my friends and colleagues were already on the website. Be sure to check out my pin boards and have fun re-pinning and surfing. I hope this will also turn out to be a good tool for promoting my artwork.

On a side note, you will notice a new icon on the right hand of my page for Pinterest, this icon and link is a wordpress widget named social profiles and did not contain Pinterest. Thanks to my web development experience I was able to fully modify it and add Pinterest, yaaa me!

content.rendered:
Been working on a new abstract contemporary painting which has been a vision of mine for awhile. I am getting my gradients to be much smoother, you almost can’t tell that this painting is 27 shades radiating out in pixelated squares.

I will be adding an overlay of circles, one inside each square. This will be in the same style of the Orange on Blue Chrome paintings.

title.rendered: Jane’s Addiction @ Massey Hall Feb 27, 2012 review

content.rendered:
I attended Jane’s Addiction last night at Massey Hall in downtown Toronto. Jane’s Addiction always was and still is one of my favorite bands to see and it was great to see them come out to such a small intimate venue. I was on the floor this night and I must say the seats are infinitely better then the balcony seats.

This is the second time I have seen Jane’s Addiction, I also seen Porno for Pyros once. No disappointment at all, they rocked it last night. Perry Farrell’s voice was great and Dave Navarro kicked ass with his guitar. While the stage wasn’t as elaborate as the first time I seen then, they really worked the space well and it was more of a grungy rock and roll type show, while the first time I seen them it was kind of like Cirque du Soleil.

Here is the set list.

Underground
Mountain Song
Just Because
Been Caught Stealing
Ain’t No Right
Ted, Just Admit It…
Twisted Tales
Classic Girl
Jane Says
I Would For You
End to the Lies
Three Days
Stop!

Encore:
Words Right Out of My Mouth
Ocean Size

I apologize for the crappy iPhone pics, it didn’t do well in the low light.

content.rendered:
Art Show Opening Tomorrow

The New Exposures, New Inspirations, New Members Art Show will be having its opening reception tomorrow, February 11th from 1-4 p.m. and everyone is welcome to attend. I have 10 paintings on display at this show, please see photo below to view my corner of the show.


If you cannot make the reception, no worries! 
The show will run from February 7th – 18th.

The other artists at this show : April Bodiam, Jess Ghankas, Mario Pretto, Milly Tseng, Ratinder Rana, and Ron Haist. Be sure to come out and see this great collection of Art!

Beaux-Arts Brampton
70-74 Main Street
North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Gallery Hours:
Tues-Fri Noon-6pm, Sat 9am-3pm
www.beaux-artsbrampton.com

In the Studio

I took a well needed break over the month of January and have just started on a new piece. Not much to say on it yet except I will be returning to a pattern design which has floated around in my head for about a year now. To the right is a photo of the painting in its initial prep stages all covered in tape. More will be revealed soon.

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

content.rendered:
New Exposures, New Inspirations, New Members

Running Feb 7th – 18th inclusive , I will be participating in a group art show(exibit) at Beaux-Arts Brampton. There will be between 8 to 10 of my latest works/pieces on display.

The opening reception is on Saturday, Feb 11th from 1-4 p.m. everyone is welcome to attend. The other artists at this show : April Bodiam, Jess Ghankas, Mario Pretto, Milly Tseng, Ratinder Rana, and Ron Haist.

Beaux-Arts Brampton
70-74 Main Street North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Gallery Hours: Tues-Fri Noon-6pm, Sat 9am-3pm
www.beaux-artsbrampton.com

In the Studio

Over the month of December I completed 2 new paintings. The first was a commissioned piece titled “I.I.XI”. My client was inspired to contact me at the Rainbow Gallery art show. We worked together using the photo of his girlfriend giving him a kiss on the cheek and transformed it into a pixel painting. The painting was then given as a New Years Eve gift.

 

The second , entitled “Blazing Heart”, drew its inspiration from a friend’s self portrait online . My model Carly, is a graphic designer who did the initial photoshop work.

Be sure to check out my Art Gallery and view my most recent art pieces.

We are happy to announce a new mobile version of our website. It is sized to fit perfectly on your mobile device without scrolling and includes a very cool mobile menu system for navigating the website.

content.rendered:
This painting was a long time on the making as a commission piece got in between. My model Carly who is also a graphic designer took this photo of herself and I just had to paint it. The colours, her hair and her thoughtful expression caught my attention and I did my best to capture it in acrylic.

This painting will be on display soon at the Beaux Arts Brampton member show this coming February (more details coming soon).

content.rendered:
I have spent the last 2 evenings attending the receptions for 2 art shows which have my work on display. The first reception was at the Jane Roos Gallery on December 7, the show runs partway through the month of December, more details on this contemporary art here. Jane Roos put on a fabulous reception, her studio was filled with lots of beautiful art. To the right is a photo of me standing in front of the painting I have on display at the gallery.

On December 8, I then headed up to Brampton to attend the Beaux-Arts Brampton Christmas show and art sale. More details on this art show here.  This show has quite a few more artists and art to view, the staff at the gallery did a wonderful job hanging the artwork and organizing the reception. Below is a photo of 3 of my paintings along with artwork from other artists in the show.

Be sure to check out both of these galleries this holiday season.

content.rendered:
Holiday Art Shows

I would like to start by thanking everyone for their support and to wish everyone a fantastic holiday season. It is a very exciting month for me as I will be on display at 2 galleries.

Jane Roos Gallery – Deck the Walls

The first show my art can be found at is the Jane Roos Gallery which is located at 108 Berkeley St. Toronto Ontario. It will be on display from December 1-23. The painting I will have on display will be At Ease.

Beaux-Arts Brampton

The second show to find my work at is Beaux-Arts Brampton which is located at 74 Main St. N Brampton. It will be running from December 06 – January 9, 2012. I will have 3 pieces on display, Depth, Orange on Blue Chrome and an untitled miniture piece.

In the Studio

I have been very busy working on new paintings, currently I am finishing a piece which will be titled “my blazing heart”. I’m not quite ready to show it, be sure to check your inbox next week to see it. I have also started a commission painting which will be ready to show at the end of the year.

One painting I did finish just recently is titled “Best Supporting Actor”
and can be seen to the right.

title.rendered: Best Supporting Actor – Osama Bin Laden – New Painting

content.rendered:
A political piece. What I am saying is simple, don’t believe what the media tells you. Was the war on terror and the Iraq war no more than a ploy for corporations to make more money through stealing the middle eastern oil, or did the U.S. really save us from the evil Middle Eastern terrorists?

All comments and feedback are encouraged and welcome. For example, do you agree or disagree with my statement. Have I made an educated thought provoking statement or am I a paranoid conspiracy theorist?

content.rendered:
I will be showing my artwork for the entire month of November at Rainbow Cinemas in the St. Lawrence Market neighborhood of Toronto. I have 6 paintings on display which are in my circular pixel style of painting. They are in the hallway of the cinema by the ticket counter and the paintings can be seen from the street. Special thanks to Art for All Canada for helping to make this possible.

 

Where to find it

The Rainbow Cinemas is located at 80 Front Street E. at Jarvis. Click here for a Google map. It is a bit tricky to find as it is inside of an open promenade. When viewed from Front St. with St. Lawrence Market behind you, you will see the Rainbow Cinema sign inside the walkway.

content.rendered:
I will be participating in an contemporary art show from February 7-18, 2012 at Beaux-Arts Brampton as part of its new members show. It is a large space and I will have multiple pieces on display during the show. Beaux-Arts Brampton is located at 70-74 Main Street North Brampton, ON L6V 1N7.

I will add more information including the reception time for the show, and my included paintings as the information becomes available to me.

content.rendered:
I attended 2 great concerts this weekend, I went to Portishead both nights they were at the Sound Academy in Toronto. This is one of my favorite bands so this was especially exciting for me. Since they haven’t been here for 14 years, I had no problems going both nights as I may never have a chance to see them again.

I was very impressed with the sound, Beth’s voice was awesome and clear and the band sounded tight. If I had any complaints it was that the set was too short (an hour and a half)  and both shows were the same. I was able to shake Beth’s hand at the end of the second show, it was great that she was so friendly.

The setlist for both nights.

Silence
Nylon Smile
Mysterons
The Rip
Sour Times
Magic Doors
Wandering Star
Machine Gun
Over
Glory Box
Chase The Tear
Cowboys
Threads

Encore:
Roads
We Carry On

content.rendered: I have found yet another interest to occupy my time. I have signed up for a yoga teacher training course which will last 6 months and starts in 2 weeks. I will be learning how to be a yoga instructor from Leewi Yoga in Port Credit and my teachers will be Michael Siddall, Jesse Enright, June Bradley, and Kiran Sohal. I will keep you updated as the course progresses, it is a 6 month program and I am very excited to begin.

title.rendered: Buskerfest Toronto is almost upon us

content.rendered:
I have been very busy the last week preparing myself for Toronto Buskerfest. I just picked up my display stands from a company in Mississauga, JJ Display Sales who gave me the best deal by far for grid displays. Just yesterday I picked up my postcard handouts from the printer, if you wish you can download a high quality print version of my postcard here.

I will be located in Berczy Park which is on Wellington St. E. (Between Church and Scott St). I will be in attendance all day Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. I encourage everyone to come to see my work, the performers at the festival, and of course to drop by and say hello.

title.rendered: Art in the Workplace at MIP

content.rendered:
I spent the evening attending an art show opening at the McMaster Innovation Park (MIP). I went specifically to support my talented and beautiful friend Christine Mathews ( visit her website www.cmbear.net ) who had 3 amazing pieces in the show.  The Exhibit will be available for viewing Monday to Friday 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. in the Atrium building of McMaster Innovation Park from July 22nd through to November 23rd, 2011. All the work at the show is for sale, so please go out and support our local artists.

Christine Mathews – Growth

Christine Mathews – The Lady: Stripped and Bare


Christine Mathews – Flight

I think 60 artists are on display at the show and while all the work was great, a couple of artists jumped out at me.

Joan Krygsman – Circus (www.joankrygsman.com)

David Magakian – The Antagonist (www.davemagak.com)

content.rendered:
I will have a booth with most of my artwork along with many other contemporary artists from Art for all Canada at this years Toronto Buskerfest from August 26-28. Toronto Buskerfest will be held in the St. Lawrence Market neighborhood and will be an extremely fun and entertaining event. If you are interested in what specific art I will have for sale, please visit my Art Gallery page and everything that says “This painting is available for purchase” will be at the Buskerfest.

You can download a high quality print version of my postcard here.

I will be located in Berczy Park which is on Wellington St. E. (Between Church and Scott St). I will be in attendance all day Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. I encourage everyone to come to see my work, the performers at the festival, and of course to drop by and say hello.

One will be available at the Buskerfest Charity Auction for Epilepsy Toronto and the other I will have for sale at my Buskerfest Toronto Booth.

content.rendered:
I will have 2 paintings in the Beaux-Arts Brampton Members Show from July 5 – 23 2011. The 2 painting I have selected for the show are Wonder and At Ease.

Beaux-Arts Brampton is located in the centre of downtown Brampton, right next to the Heritage Theatre. 70-74 Main Street North  Brampton, ON L6V 1N7 Tel: (905) 454-5677

content.rendered:
Thank you everyone who attended my contemporary art show at Arts Hamilton.  I am very grateful for the support and feedback and I hope everyone enjoyed my work. A special thanks to Stephen Near who organized the show and opening.

The next place to catch a couple of my pieces will be at Beaux-Arts Brampton from July 5 – 23 for the members show. I will have 2 paintings at this show, and space permitting they may be At Ease and Wonder.

content.rendered:
I have just finished a painting which I have named Blue on Orange Chrome (yes I still need help with naming), it is a small 1 foot square piece. This painting will be available for purchase at the Buskerfest Charity Auction for Epilepsy Toronto. I am still unsure of the where and when of this auction and will keep you posted as I learn more about it.

I have created another painting which are the exact same colours except opposite, I will post it after I finish the small details and touch ups.

content.rendered: This saturday, June 25 I will be attending a Yogathon in Port Credit to raise money for the United Nations World Food Program. It will be run by Annette from Free Spirit Yoga at her Port Credit Studio. If anyone is interested in sponsoring me, send me an email about how much you would like to donate. If you would like to go, please contact me, if you need a ride, I may be able to pick you up.

title.rendered: A couple of new mini paintings

content.rendered: In preparation for Buskerfest Toronto I am starting to paint small paintings which will be less expensive and easier to sell (hopefully). These 2, 1 foot square paintings will be the same style, but opposite colour. I think I will name them Blue/Orange Crome, why Chrome you ask? That will become clear when they are finished and I have my overlay of circles on them. If anyone can come up with better names for them I will be all ears. I seem to fail in the naming department.

title.rendered: Some very cool posters from the 60s

content.rendered: I got an email from the Grateful Dead with a link to some history and quite a few awesome concert posters from the sixties and the 5 Artists who created them,  Rick Griffin, Alton Kelley, Victor Moscoso, Stanley Mouse and Wes Wilson. I am getting quite inspired by these posters, perhaps we will see some of their influence in some upcoming paintings. Check out the concert posters here. Some of them are quite hard to read, I suspect they would become easier to read with some LSD (not that I would know). I hope you enjoy them as much as I do.

title.rendered: Artist in the Family: Christine Mathews

content.rendered: Please check out Christine Mathews [http://www.cmbear.net/], she does some fabulous work in many mediums, my favorites are her oil pieces. She also has some upcoming exhibits in the Hamilton area, check out her website for more details.

title.rendered: Panoramic view of my art show

content.rendered:
Thank you everyone who attended tonight’s events. A special thanks to Stephen and Dan from Arts Hamilton who helped to set up the event and Barbara from the Pearl Company Art Bus who brought a bus load of viewers.

I spliced together 3 photos which were the 3 separate walls my Art was hanging from to create a panoramic view of my show. The event will run intil the end of June, be sure to drop in and see.

content.rendered:
I have been given a great opportunity to showcase my artwork at the Arts Hamilton gallery in downtown Hamilton as part of the Night in The Village event sponsored by the International Village BIA. I will have all of my recent paintings on display and I encourage everyone to come and take a look.

The show will open on June 3 2011 and run until the end of the month. Everyone is welcome to attend the opening which will start at 7 p.m. on June 3rd 2011.

I have created a postcard for the event, you can pick them at the event or download it here.

Arts Hamilton
279 King Street East
Hamilton, Ontario
L8N 1B9
Phone: (905) 481-3218

content.rendered:
Tomorrow (Friday June 3rd 2011) I will be opening my first solo contemporary art show. It will run from June 3-30th, 2011 and will be located at Arts Hamilton. I have created a post card which you can download here and will also be available at the gallery. The opening tomorrow will run from 7 – 9 p.m. and everyone is welcome.

Arts Hamilton
279 King Street East
Hamilton, Ontario
L8N 1B9
Phone: (905) 481-3218

content.rendered:
August 25-28 2011 is Toronto Buskerfest which takes place in the St. Lawrence Market neighborhood in downtown Toronto. I am lucky enough to have gotten a booth to display and sell my artwork thanks to Art for All Canada.

I will be posting more information on this event as we get closer to the date. Please come out to see all the great performers at Buskerfest and possibly buy one of my paintings.

This is the second piece of great news I have received this week for my artwork as I also have been given my first show at the Arts Hamilton gallery for the month of June as part of the Night in The Village event in downtown Hamilton. More information about this show on the Shows page.

content.rendered: My new basement bedroom is now complete, now I just need to move into it. It was very hard to photograph the whole room, hopefully using the closet mirror helps you see it a bit better. I had lots of unfinished basement behind the furnace, so I turned it into a bedroom.

content.rendered: Last year someone suggested I put my tulip bulbs around the roses so there will always be flowers in the spring and summer. I wish I could remember who it was as it was a great idea. Whoever you were, thank you.

content.rendered:
I attended day one of the Art for All Canada conference at Metro Hall in Toronto and was very pleased with the event. The day started off with a catwalk show of artist with their artwork which I didn’t participate in but enjoyed watching. I should have a link to a youtube video of this soon.

The workshops were very informative, I attended public relations and community volunteerism by Ben Benedict and marketing yourself and your artwork by Suzie B, both of which helped me formulate my own plans for furthering myself in the art community. Another interesting workshop was photographing your artwork by Kevin Backs where I leaned quite a few photography techniques and how to use the manual settings on my camera which was very useful indeed.

Golden Acrylics were present with a display, lots of free samples and more importantly their rep spent a good amount of time speaking with me and teaching me so much useful information on how to use paints properly and all the supporting additives which help me get much more from my paint. I learned so much from him.

I will have the Focus Painting on display in Metro Hall Toronto from March 5-12. The show also has the work of about 100 other contemporary and traditional artists, please check it out if you are in the area.

Metro Hall,
55 John Street,
Toronto, Ontario, Canada

content.rendered: While I only wanted to buy 2 colours, Curry’s had a special today that was if I bought 4 tubes they would give me 4 free jars of paint. Not one to pass a deal on Golden Acrylics I got suckered into buying 2 more tubes, yet considering the price of these paints, it ended up being a very good deal…

title.rendered: A couple of new paintings in progress

content.rendered: Just a quick update, I starting working on 2 new op art paintings. The orange will be a pattern I have had in my mind for months, I just love that orange. The other painting will be a portrait made up of circles similar to Wonder, I will use my daughter Sierra as the model. These are not finished pieces by any means, just a glimpse of my technique.

content.rendered:
My painting Focus was been selected to appear in the Fourth Annual Beaux-Arts Brampton Open Juried Show on April 05, 2011 – April 30, 2011. There was be an opening reception on April 8th where Focus and many other pieces were on display.

Beaux-Arts Brampton is located at:
70-74 Main Street North
Brampton, ON L6V 1N7
Tel: (905) 454-5677

content.rendered:
Wonder

I have just finished the painting Wonder which is named after the look of wonder I tried to capture from the photo of my son. It is solid circles of colour overlaid on top of a pixelated gradient background. The panting really comes into focus at about  20 feet from the canvas.

I will be submitting this painting to the Beaux-Arts Brampton juried art show this weekend along with Focus. Wish me luck.

content.rendered:
I have just put my application in for the Beaux-Arts Brampton open juried art show. I will be submitting 2 paintings with the chance to win cash prizes and a chance to display my art at their gallery. I decided to submit the Focus painting and the new portrait painting I am working on now. I asked friends and family from facebook to submit photos and got a great response, but I have yet to decide on which to use first. The image you see is my background in progress, it will be a pixel gradient background in squares with a pixel foreground of circles which will have the face.

I plan to learn more about the Beaux-Arts Brampton artist cooperative, it has a gallery downstairs, artist studios upstairs, and great contemporary art covering all walls. They host many shows, workshops, and classes. Check them out if you are in the area.

content.rendered:
This weekend the Art for All Canada show is on and  I wanted to create a new painting for it. I pulled it off with many very long days and a few headaches and I am pleased with the result. It started off like the I Love You Cerulean Blue and Pixel Glow paintings, I then put 3/4″ circular stickers on it (900 of them)  and painted over it. Lastly I was up to 2 a.m. last night pulling off the stickers.

Here are a few photos of the process. Today will be for small touch ups. The Art for All Canada show starts tomorrow and my painting will be on display all next week at Metro Hall.

Covered in stickers

Coated in paint

FInal Result

title.rendered: I Love You Cerulean Blue is complete (maybe)

content.rendered: I have finally finished the I Love You Cerulean Blue painting. This painting was a beast, I clocked in about 95 hours on the painting. To critique myself, I would say it is kind of “meh”, a bit washed out with no contrast which is why I say it is maybe complete. I came up with a new technique for my next painting which I may apply to this one after some experimentation. So for now it is done, but it may get changed.

content.rendered: My daughter Sierra got published in a book named You’re My Hero, which is a Girl Guide book filled with short submissions from Girl Guides.  I am very pleased that she is so creative and took advantage of this opportunity, I guess she takes after me just a bit. My copy just arrived in the mail (I ordered it online from web link above). The photo to the right is the badge she earned for this accomplishment.

content.rendered:
Cody & Luther Dickinson

Robert Plant and the Band of Joy

Robert Plant

A very good concert and much different than what I expected. The opening band, 2 brothers, Cody & Luther Dickinson were awesome. They played some great heavy guitar blues.

Robert Plant and the Band of Joy impressed me and were pretty fabulous. One thing I really liked is that they switched up the vocals alot so it wasn’t just Robert Plant and his back up band, they were a complete package. They did some Zeppelin covers and changed them up a bit which I thought was interesting. A couple of songs that really stood out were Tall Cool One and Ramble On, yet I enjoyed every one. Here is the set list..

Cindy, I’ll Marry You Someday
Angel Dance
Down To The Sea
House of Cards
Rich Woman
Love Throw A Line
Misty Mountain Hop
Satisfied Mind
Satan Your Kingdom Must Come Down
Somewhere Trouble Don’t Go
12 Gates To The City
Houses of the Holy
Tall Cool One
Ramble On
Gallows Pole

Encore:

Monkey
Rock & Roll
And We Bid You Goodnight

content.rendered: I received an email from the Grateful Dead today that was addressed, Dear Dead Head. May seem silly but it made me smile, where else can you receive such a casual greeting and it is perfectly accepted. The email was for my personalized copy of the new Europe 72 full tour box set which is coming up and that made their website crash from all the responses… Even with the big mess up, I still want it, I’m glad they let me reserve a personalized copy of it.

content.rendered:
cerulean blue taped

I am just over the halfway mark with the cerulean blue painting. Here are some before and after photos I took while removing the tape. I am generally pleased with how it is turning out but it seems that the transition to the darkest tones is a bit abrupt and I will need to do quite a bit of tweaking at the end to smooth it out. It is almost of if my mixed colours settled in their jars and lightened up.

I also had the tape  randomly remove some spots of paint which will need to be touched up, I think I need to let the paint cure for a few days before I tape it up again to prevent that from happening again.

content.rendered: I have finished the first coat of the first taping for this painting, this photo will give a rough idea of what the finished product will look like. I have been tracking my time for this painting for the first time and in some ways that is a bad thing as I don’t think I will be able to sell any paintings for a affordable amount of money. At least I am enjoying myself.

content.rendered:
I have just finished mixing 25 shades of cerulean blue for my next painting, which I think I will name “I love you Cerulean Blue” (thanks to Sonic Youth for the name inspiration). It took about 6 hours as I spent so much time testing each shade. The purple glow painting was tricky and I didn’t want to make the same mistakes I made with it and have to redo many of the shades.

In the photo you can see how I put them all in little numbered containers along with my final colour test. I won’t give a preview of the painting they will create, but I will post the occasional photo of the process. I have spent 10 hours in total for this painting and I have yet to put a drop of paint on the canvas.

content.rendered:
I am happy to have finished this new painting. It was an experiment in subtly, using 4 very similar off-white shades to create a shimmering effect. I am not sure that I achieved that effect, but I am not unhappy with the end result. This was very hard to photograph, thanks to Neil Kilpatrick for some camera tips. I find this painting looks best against an dark wall.

Now I will begin my new pixel glow painting, stay tunes for updates.

content.rendered:
So I just bought a 4 x 3 canvas for my next pixel painting. It is a bit intimidating, almost as big as my Christmas tree. I have never attempted a painting in this style at that size, the amount of taping is starting to scare me already.

I have to listen to the voice in my head though, it keeps telling me that bigger is better for this kind of art. I hope I am listening to the right voice…

content.rendered:
I had a bit of spare time this weekend and was finally able to get most of this website done. It is a blog based website using wordpress and I suspect I will continue to tweak it as time goes by. The next item I will add will be a photo gallery once I get all my photos organized.

I find that I tend to use this website for experimenting and this time was no exception. It was my quick lesson on how to use and manipulate wordpress. I don’t think I’ll change that part of it moving forward as  I won’t want to lose the content it will accumulate.

Please look around, leave lots of comments, and share with your friends and family.

content.rendered: I just got 2 tickets for Robert Plant at the Sony Center in Toronto on Sunday January the 23rd. I have an extra if anyone is interested and the price is $125 and they are in the orchestra section. I have never seen him before, I hope he blows me away with some great Zeppelin.

content.rendered:
A great event with a lot of fantastic art, I was very impressed by the artwork that was in the show. Here I am looking very serious in front of my Pixel Tree Painting at Art on the Fly Hamilton. I was disappointed that the painting didn’t sell, but it is on display at Arts Hamilton 279 King Street East Hamilton, Ontario. Please go check it out.

A special thanks to Arts Hamilton for putting on a great event.
More information on the event here.

content.rendered: As you may have noticed, I have a new website. This is a blog based website and I will slowly be adding features, updating and tweaking as I go over the next few weeks. If it is every broken, rest assured I am aware of it and working on it. It is a custom WordPress and I have been experimenting with building a custom WordPress template, it is giving me a fast lesson on WordPress development.
